text: Today I was proud to join a bipartisan group of leaders and fellow advocates for criminal justice reform at @LouisvilleUL to talk about expungement, the need for second chances, and passing the #FirstStepAct before the end of the year. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DuEhgdxVYAEqtNp.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DuEhgdhUwAA5mo1.jpg

Saudi blogger #Raif Badawi remains imprisoned in #SaudiArabia, along with recently detained women's rights activists.

RT @SenateDems There is less than one week left to sign up, re-enroll, or change your health insurance for 2019! 
 
Make sure you’re covered by visiting http://healthcare.gov. http://pbs.twimg.com/tweet_video_thumb/DuEO5WQW4AA0F9o.jpg https://video.twimg.com/tweet_video/DuEO5WQW4AA0F9o.mp4

December 15 is your last chance to sign up for a new health care plan under the open enrollment period of the ACA (deadline is January 15 in California). For the majority of Americans plans are only $50-$100 per month. Don’t miss out and #GetCovered at --> https://www.healthcare.gov/

#Uyghur scholar #Ilham Tohti is serving a life sentence in #China for his work to foster dialogue between #Uyghurs and #Han Chinese & expose the repressive policies in #Xinjiang: 
https://twitter.com/SenRubioPress/status/1055992956916776961 QT @SenRubioPress Uyghur scholar #Ilham Tohti remains in prison on a life sentence over outrageous ‘separatism charges’. He worked to foster dialogue between #Uyghurs and #Han Chinese and expose the repressive policies in #Xinjiang. He should be released immediately #ExpressionNOToppression http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Dqej_vXX0AArsvw.jpg

.@Reuters journalists Wa Lone and Kyaw Soe Oo are unjustly imprisoned by the Burmese government for reporting the truth of the #Rohingya atrocities:
https://twitter.com/SenRubioPress/status/1039634632030007296 QT @SenRubioPress Today @SenJeffMerkley and I urged @SecPompeo to secure the release of @Reuters journalists Wa Lone & Kyaw Soe Oo, who were wrongfully detained while investigating a massacre of Rohingya Muslims & sentenced to 7 years in prison in Burma earlier this month. https://www.rubio.senate.gov/public/index.cfm?p=Press-Releases&id=316534B5-42C2-47C9-93D4-195D30EBF899

Tashi Wangchuk, a Tibetan language advocate remains imprisoned in #China for trying to protect traditional #Tibetan culture: 
https://twitter.com/SenRubioPress/status/1033118122809720832 QT @SenRubioPress Last week, a Chinese court rejected the appeal of Tibetan language advocate Tashi Wangchuk in what can only be described as a mockery of justice. The Chinese gov’t should release him immediately. #ExpressionNOToppression http://ppdcecc.gov/QueryResultsDetail.aspx?PrisonerNum=11230 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DlZfdJFXgAE_nUu.jpg

RT @MDAndersonNews Congrats to our Dr. Jim Allison, who accepted the #NobelPrize today in Sweden. Allison’s pioneering work has led to new and effective #cancer therapies that train the immune system to attack cancer.

Learn more about Dr. Allison and his work: https://www.mdanderson.org/newsroom/nobel-prize.html?cmpid=nobel_www_immunotherapy #endcancer http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DuE25uTV4AYrxc2.jpg

Human rights are fundamentally about treating each other with dignity & respect & seeing the value in every person. On this #HumanRightsDay, celebrating the bold vision of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, we still have much work to do to ensure that dream is fulfilled.

Right now, a single parent can be held in jail for a nonviolent offense awaiting trial for weeks, months, or even years. Why? Simply because they cannot afford to pay bail. That’s just wrong.

The @GovMurphy administration believes @UnivHospNewark needs transformational leadership to improve care quality, but also to fulfill its promise to Newark. Our report: https://nj.gov/health/news/2018/approved/20181210a.shtml

On the 70th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of #HumanRights, human dignity remains under attack in many parts of the world. We must must recommit to protecting & advancing fundamental rights that are endowed--not by gov't or man, but by the Creator--to all individuals.

The bad news: our president doesn't believe in science.

The good news: today 1,000 young people stood up to demand that Congress take on the fossil fuel industry and transform our energy system to sustainable energy.

We're going to win this fight for our people and planet. https://twitter.com/sunrisemvmt/status/1072192289274032130 QT @sunrisemvmt We are unstoppable. We out here @HouseDemocrats #GreenNewDeal http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DuExMnhVsAElWhz.jpg

There are powerful forces in our country & across the world attempting to deny people their most basic rights, but let's remember today & every day that we must continue our fight to ensuring that “All human beings are born free and equal in dignity and rights.” #HumanRightsDay

RT @ezraklein In each of the five years preceding Paul Ryan's speakership, annual deficits fell. In each of the three years since he's been speaker, they rose.
